Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: tested multiformat pre and post activation, samples returned after activation fine, no `oracelsfund` required on the pre-activation oracle after activation. ran a few other maual tests, no issues found. Only thing worth mention but not at all a problem was that `oraclesfund` could be repeated after already being done.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: so activation appears to have no ill effect on pre activation oracles or the data they hold within

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: Which branch has the new stuff?

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: FSM, but using timestamp for activation. Need to edit ~/komodo/src/cc.oracles.cpp

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
change `#define PUBKEY_SPOOFING_FIX_ACTIVATION 1558455503
` to a timestamp in past, then rebuild

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: is "using timestamps" necessary?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: if i'm launching a new smart chain, do i care about this?   or is this for backwards compat with existing launched FSM branches?

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
The changes will be applied at the July 15th hardfork timestamp. 
There is a new RPC `oraclesfund` after the hardfork which needs to be run before you can subscribe/register

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: The other change is that `oraclesdata` will use `baton`, which is a registered publisher's R-address, instead of the `batonutxo` which is currently used

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: so if you want to test the changes, you need to build with a modified timestamp so it is activated.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: understood.  thanks.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: kmd.io

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
what would be the best way to retrieve historical samples in oracles after `oraclesamples` uses `baton` instead of `batonutxo`?
with `batonutxo`, you can find the latest using `oraclesinfo`, and get x number of datapoints back. You can also use an old `batonutxo` to find samples from a specific batonutxo back. 
it seems that `baton` defaults to the latest entry. If I want samples for a time period, is there a recommended way to retrieve just that, without also filtering out everything that happened since then?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: record the latest baton at specific time periods, encode the sample number in the data also

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator I noticed similar problem few days ago, that you cannot fetch specific data tx as with oraclesamples you would need to get all data and then iterate through it. So we added oraclesample RPC that returns data from single data tx. When I made it I was thinking do we need also to fetch number of txs but decided to implement single tx. If it is very convenient to have fetching x txs from specific tx we can add it easily...

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: great, I'll test that out. I can see lookback from tx being handy, but I can work with single sample at the moment. I assume getting a list of tx related to the oracle baton address shouldnt be too difficult? from there can just loop over a subset of the list

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: pls let me know when ready to test out which branch / repo etc and I can add that RPC to our autotests & docs

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
Would it be difficult to add a "utxo count" output to `oraclesinfo`
to send multiple `oraclesdata` in same block, oracle needs more than one utxo (e.g. 10utxo by running `oraclessubscribe` 10 times).
utxo count output can show what its rate capacity per block is.

Also wondering if/how oracle response may be affected by the cumulative transactions it has been involved in. With addresses in wallet.dat, we can use `cleanwallettransactions` to speed up RPCs that communicate with wallet. 
Are oracle baton addresses similarly affected or able to be cleaned?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Such data points amount indication sounds like an useful addition

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I think we can show utxo count easily, let me just check are there any difficulties...

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content:
`An oracle is to blame
Essentially, oracles are used in blockchains to verify real word information and then report back the finding to the blockchain, triggering an implementation of smart contracts. In this case, a Synthetix oracle, responsible for providing external data to Synthetix‚Äôs smart contracts, transmitted false data on June 25, which a bot took advantage of.`

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: https://cointelegraph.com/news/sophisticated-trading-bot-exploits-synthetix-oracle-funds-recovered

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @redp1ll You must do a register from a node that is ran with -pubkey= as the one you want to register!

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Also you must do oralcesfund first on order to prove that you are the owner of pubkey.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: This was done in order to prevent others to register a pubkey that they do not own!

Author: redp1ll#3268
Content: @Mihailo I'm running the 2 node setup on one machine with different .conf files and run both nodes with -pubkey= option. I did the oraclesfund before that too

Content: Any idea what I'm doing wrong?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I see that you are using the same pubkey on both nodes, so I suppose that they do not have private keys for that pubkey on both?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Usually you ran the node with pubkey which you have in your wallte on that node. You can run the node with some other pubkey, but then you are not able to sign transaction which need privatekey for that pubkey on that node.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:

`CC Eval EVAL_ORACLES Invalid: unexpected OraclesValidate for register spending tx 3cb077f66c9b56a56ce8f586cd6af7b6ef9e7b6c51c42ca8a12b6945b5db903f
`
once this happens, it wont progress to next block. Is there a way to fix or overcome this?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator Hmmm, it may be the fix for pubkey spoofing. But it is time activated. Can you give more details on register tx, when is the block in which is that tx and etc.

Content: https://pastebin.com/yWgJ9q94

Content: if its not an easyfix, I can kill the chain and start again, I think I'm the only one running it unless someone in LABs still is also. Working on an oracles_export script now to migrate existing data if it comes to that (it holds all data for display on https://oracle.earth/).

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Hmmm, some how that refister tx is spending CC vout and there was no spending of CC vout in register until the spoofing fix. The date of the block is June 14th but the fix starts at July 15th.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I`ll sync the chain to see the tx itself

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator Or if you can paste me the decoded tx that fails would be even better.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Hmmm, I have synced the chain. I see the tx. Let me check

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator This is strange. The tx seems to be oraclesfund tx, but it is in time when spoofing fix is not active. Still I don't know yet how it complained about unexpected oraclesvalidate for register!

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Are you sure the time is correct on nodes running that chain?

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: yeah time is correct. Could my fault for tesing the oraclesfund rpc before spoofing fix activation (I recall changing the activation time at some stage to prepare for the change, but thought it was on a different chain). I'll see if I can get decoded tx, though I might not have that wallet active anymore

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Even if you tested fund before it shouldn't complain. I'm totaly confused how the CC validation is triggered when there is no CC input spent @jl777c

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ah, no. It is a problem of spending tx 3cb077f66c9b56a56ce8f586cd6af7b6ef9e7b6c51c42ca8a12b6945b5db903f, so it is probably register that is failing...

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @smk762 -  dracocanis ominator Could be the problem that you did fund and register before the fix active. But we should also prevent that the chain is stuck...

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: Most likely cause is premature activation, testing rpc, then changing activation back to actual.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yes, that is it.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I've commented the else in oraclesregister validation and it passes

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: So basically this shouldn't happen, but for example if anybody was sending the fund and register before the fix activation (for example he creates the tx manually) it could break the sync of the chain.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @jl777c This is very unlikely but should we do something about this?

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: decoded tx - https://pastebin.com/g94Jvrgn

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I've got it already, thnx.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: I'm halfway through a migration script, and its a rare situation so unlikely to affect production chains

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: YEs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if it can be worked around, that seems sufficient

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: You can comment the else part in register validation and it will pass. But without code change it cannot be worked around.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i mean, is this specific oracle so important? can a new one be made as a replacement

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: No, the problem is if someone made and oracle with fund/register tx before the pubkey spoofing fix was activated (this could only be done when moving the time activation or manually creating a tx), then it will stuck the chain sync. But this is very unlikely that someone has done on production chain!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, so can we ignore this? it seems it cant be done anymore and is only for legacy instances?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yes, I think we can ignore it. Just wanted to check with you üòâ
